attributes.action: Regulate car insurance companies over cost of car insurance
attributes.background: We the everyday motorists pay excessive amounts for car insurance, thre needs to be a look into their practice's and costing and needs to be capped or regulated
attributes.additional_details:
Car insurance for a 33yr old driver with no points , no accidents and 0 no claims on a 1.4 - £700 

Car insurance for same driver with 2 non fault accidents, 9 points for speeding when no accident involved and 1 years no claims on a 1.2 - £3500 

How can a insurance company expect to charge 5x for a smaller car when there has never been a cost to them .

attributes.action: Empower the Police to seize and destroy Mobile Phones
attributes.background: So many people are killed or injured every week as a result of road traffic accidents where mobile phone distraction is the cause. Please sign & support this petition. you will be saving lives!

attributes.action: Let merchants choose to trade using Imperial and/or Metric measurements.
attributes.background: EU law requires UK merchants to display weights and measures in metric units. Simultaneous display of Imperial units is allowed as an afterthought. Per Brexit, Parliament should enact a law allowing merchants to choose to display weights and measures in either Imperial or Metric units, or jointly.

attributes.action: Accept Functional Skills as an equivalent qualification for EYE's Level 3
attributes.background: I am very concerned about the negative impact of the Government’s decision that all Level 3 Early Years Educators must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths with no equitable alternative such as Functional Skills allowed.
attributes.additional_details: Your policy will mean there will be a significant shortfall in the number of Level 3 childcare practitioners, which threatens the quality of care that children will get in early years settings.

attributes.action: Cancel the Validity of the EU referendum as the government held it illegally.
attributes.background: No votes for European residents but votes for Commonwealth residents. None for long standing Brits living elsewhere in the EU. The result is too marginal to call decisive. The 2 million EU citizens working and living  in the UK directly affected by this should be given a vote at a new referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Referendums are one off events, so the rules about who can vote are different each time. www.electoralcommission.org.uk

Millions of EU UK Citizens have helped this country be the success it has been. A set of voting eligibility rules should have been laid out for EU citizens who have been here a certain amount of time, made the UK their home and contributed.

attributes.action: Re-open the Shrewsbury to Stafford Railway Line via Wellington & Newport.
attributes.background: I attended interview in Cannock. 1 and half hours to get there by Rail. If we had a connection from Shrewsbury to Stafford, via Wellington & Newport I would have only travel fo 43 minutes, half the amount of time. The route should be Shrewsbury to Walsall via Wellington, Newport, Stafford & Rugely
attributes.additional_details: Association of Train Operating Companies, in its Connecting Communities: Expanding Access to the Rail Network report, called for funding to reopen the line from Stafford to Wellington as part of £500m scheme to open 33 stations on 14 lines closed in the Beeching Axe. A group called Shropshire, Telford & the Marches Strategic Rail Group voted to lobby government to invest in reopening the line, a quicker alternative of direct link to London. Estimated cost would be roughly £230 million.

attributes.action: Introduce Politics and Citizenship to the core UK school curriculum
attributes.background: In light of the recent Brexit and US presidential election, we strongly believe that all students should understand the nature of politics and their role and responsibilities as citizens and voters.

attributes.action: Abolish unisex toilets in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: In my child's school the toilets have become unisex. The school gave parents and children no notice prior to this happening. My child was shocked when a boy walked into the toilet. The girls in the school do not like it and some boys and girls have stopped using the toilet. This is a health concern.
attributes.additional_details:
These toilets are not like the ones we have at home with the sink, bin toilet in one room behind a closed door. There is a gap at the bottom and the top, there is no privacy. 

Both genders will be going through hormonal & bodily changes. Some girls start their menstrual cycle early. Will they not be embarrassed to use a shared toilet 

Both girls & boys have the right to explore their bodies in their own privacy amongst the same gender. The unisex toilets restrict this development which is sad.

attributes.action: Waive the Police charges for the return of stolen vehicles to victims
attributes.background: Like many people I was recently the victim of motorcycle theft,  the police recently found the vehicle and told me it was subject to a £40 a day holding charge.  This is nothing but shameful profiteering on a victims loss from the Metroploitan Police a their policy should be changed.

attributes.action: Update Housing Association tenants on the right to buy. We voted in good faith!
attributes.background: Give HA tenants some information and a timeline regarding right to buy extension. There have been no updates on the pilot scheme and there has now been talk of the right to buy extension not being completed till 2020 this is a totally unacceptable timeline.

attributes.action: Hold a public enquiry to the conduct of both sides of the EU referendum campaign
attributes.background: The way in which the recent campaigns were conducted was a disgrace with the public appearing to be either mislead or lied too. The facts and statements made by all sides should be considered and the enquiry should have the power to sanction those found to be either lying or misleading the public.

attributes.action: Increase awareness and services for those suffering from eating disorders
attributes.background: We the undersigned ask that the government both develop greater awareness and increase funding to mental health services for those suffering from an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details: We are a group of students from the University of Exeter campaigning to raise awareness of the lack of support for sufferers of eating disorders, particularly in the South West.

attributes.action: Debate the implementation of a carbon tax in the House of Commons
attributes.background:
Climate change is currently happening and economic experts cite a carbon tax as a solid and progressive step. Reducing carbon consumption and also taxation needed from other sources. 

Carbon tax would drastically reduce the rates of income tax. More money for you and a better environment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.carbontax.org/why-a-carbon-tax/

'A robust tax on carbon pollution will create powerful incentives inducing policy-makers and individuals to reduce carbon emissions through conservation, substitution and innovation' 

'Currently, the prices of electricity, gasoline and other fuels reflect little or none of the long-term costs from climate change or even the near-term health costs of burning fossil fuels'

attributes.action: Make it law that all cyclists have to wear helmets.
attributes.background: After seeing the damage falling from a bicycle can cause I feel it should now be law for anyone using a cycle to have to wear a cycle helmet !  More bicycles are now capable of the same speeds as mopeds and scooters and some electric bicycles can reach speeds in excess of 20mph! lets make this law..
attributes.additional_details:
Studies show that wearing a helmet can make it 70% less likely that you suffer major head trauma should you fall off or be involved in an accident while riding a bicycle. If you think your to cool to wear one spend an hour in the NCCU and think again.
We have rules and regulations for many things less damaging lets make this law and save lives.

attributes.action: Ensure that students from year7 are taught in schools how to detect child abuse.
attributes.background: We're a group of students that believe that child abuse needs to be reduced. We have found astonishing figures that kids 4 years old and under are most affected. Most kids that have been physically, verbally or sexually abused are unaware that they are being abused as they don't understand the signs
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 5 children die every day because of child abuse and 1 out of 3 girls and 1 out of 5 boys will be sexually abused before they reach age 18.
For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering alone

attributes.action: Scrap interest rates on student loans.
attributes.background: Interest charged on student loans should be scrapped for everyone who has one and for students of the future. The continual rise in the interest charged is making paying the loans back even harder and unfair.

attributes.action: Motorcycle filtering signs.
attributes.background: to lower the risk of deaths and near misses on the UK motorways, filtering signs to be placed on the gang ways above motorways or on the side of roads informing other motorists to look out for bikes. Also stipulate the legal filtering speed limits in the highway code.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the amount of motorcycle deaths and/or near misses on the UK roads down to filtering, as a road safety intensive nation wide I feel the government should introduce a filtering sign along UK roads, to remind other road users of filtering bikes and the legalities (stated in section 88 of the highway code) to be move vigilant for filtering motorcycles.

attributes.action: Give free public transport to homeless people in UK
attributes.background: Whilst we find ways and seek solutions to Homelessness it would be a good start by offering access to public transport. This way we would offer them some respite and support that they need in order to improve their lives. Moreover, it would not cost us much as it is already there.
attributes.additional_details:
In the current climate Homelessness is rising and there are no easy solutions to this. Local Authorities are struggling to cope with the demand and are not able to house most people registered as Homeless due to the lack of Housing supply.

We believe that it would be only just fair that as a great country, United Kingdom would allow anyone who is registered as Homeless to have free public transport. This would enable them to go to work, attend job centres, hospital or housing appointments.

attributes.action: Stop passport checks on pregnant NHS patients
attributes.background: The proposals by St. George's University Hospital Trust, and backed by the Home Office, that pregnant people would be subject to mandatory passport checks before being able to access care to crack down on "health tourism" are deeply worrying, steeped in racism, and should be rejected immediately.
attributes.additional_details: Antenatal wards already require a form with proof of eligibility but these cannot always be done fully. The proposals would require checks to be stricter and could, in the view of multiple critics and medical staff, lead to higher risk to patient health. These proposals give no assurance that patients would have access to care regardless of immigration status, as is current government policy and law. Focus on "health tourism" is a racist smokescreen for the Conservatives' destruction of the NHS.

attributes.action: Allow the british army to grow beards like the navy
attributes.background: It should be allowed for the british army to grow beards, the navy are allowed so why isnt the army? If you are in the british army and you are a sikh then you can grow a beard, this goes against equalitiy and diversity.
attributes.additional_details: The navy has regulations and guidelines for what classes as a beard, why can the army not have the same?

attributes.action: Stop the child tax credit cuts for a third child born from 6th April 2017.
attributes.background: This policy would lead to child poverty and charities are concerned that this would result in poverty and generations of lower classes whereby this right is only for the privileged. Those who said we are all in it together can not implement this policy. Thereby we urge the government to review this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/sites/default/files/The%20Childrens%20Society%20-%20two%20child%20limit%20supplementary%20evidence.docx

http://www.barnardos.org.uk/poverty_full_report_07.pdf

attributes.action: Scrap HS2. Spend the money on existing infrastructure, trains and rolling stock
attributes.background: HS2 benefits very few people. It is already £200m over budget. The Sheffield connection is cancelled and route has changed. The money is better spent on improving existing routes and reinstating some of the old routes to increase access to a greater proportion of the population.

attributes.action: Make welfare services VAT exempt
attributes.background: Why should families using organisations to help them with Dementia care, loneliness, respite etc pay VAT? Help us deal with the red tape that makes VAT applicable to a much needed elderly care service by signing this petition.
attributes.additional_details: If an organisation is not a Charity, or it is 'out of scope' for CQC regulation, VAT is required to be paid by end users. Support in the home does have to involve personal care. Currently, families choosing services from a LTD or LLP company to help themselves or a loved one rather than state or charity provision are penalised with 20% VAT on vital care services.  Volunteer services and Charities can't cope with demand, so if you are willing to  pay for services that are not "personal care", we do not think VAT should have to be added. Seniors Helping Seniors® is an organisation that has evidence of great care outcomes for families and we are fighting the VAT charges. Refund will be passed back to every single family who has had to pay VAT to date.

attributes.action: Allow all emergency services to use spit hoods!
attributes.background: Several infectious diseases are contained in saliva, I wish this subject to be discussed in Parliament and come down on the side of all emergency services.

attributes.action: Increase funding for investigating tool theft for tradesmen.
attributes.background:
Yet to find a tradesman who hasn't had their tools stolen at some point in their life. It seems like there is very little investigation into tool theft and cases are quickly closed.

Took theft is extremely expensive for the victim and damages our careers and livelihoods.
attributes.additional_details: I want to see the police pay more attention to tool theft and harsher penalties for those caught handling stolen tools.

attributes.action: Ban all religious practises from public outdoor areas.
attributes.background: Increasing trend of spreading religious practices, wordpship, prayers to parks, streets and in other public places directly discriminate non believing population and prevent peaceful coexistence of all religions with non believing population in the UK.

attributes.action: Make Southern Rail give automatic refunds to all customers affected by delays.
attributes.background: For months now, those of us who travel on Southern have been blighted by delays due to 'staff sickness' which has since morphed into 'a shortage of train crew'. Annual ticket holders get no compensation and it is not simple for others to claim, so Southern continue to profit on poor performance.
attributes.additional_details:
Southern services continue to be severely affected by train crew availability including a high level of conductor sickness, which is leading to some services being cancelled for part or all of their journey.
Planned industrial action affecting Southern services on Tuesday 21 June
A list of the services which have been pre-cancelled is available here.

http://www.southernrailway.com/your-journey/plan-your-journey/live-running-information/incidents/#iAD816EDFC4114A84A299ABF7D41FE43F

attributes.action: Install adequate road lighting on the A249 sittingbourne
attributes.background:
Night time driving is never easy,  and unlit roads are a major hazard to all of us using them at night. 
The A249, sittingbourne is a perfect example of this problem.  Something needs to be done before more accidents happen!!!!
attributes.additional_details: From the m20, onto the A249, past Detling Hill through to keycole roundabout, the lighting at night is ridiculously poor & so dangerous to drivers using this stretch of road at night. There is no street lighting & also no cats eyes on the road, and road markings are very worn and near invisable

attributes.action: Have a vote of no confidence in Rt Hon Jeremy Hunt.
attributes.background: The budget for mental health trusts fell by 2% from 2013/14 to 2014/15. Also, in the year April 2016 the budget for mental health trusts was projected to rise by a dismal 0.3%. Jeremy Hunt is ruining our NHS, which was created after WW2 to assist people regardless of their socioeconomic background.
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned call upon parliament to hold a vote of no confidence in Rt Hon Jeremy Hunt. Arguably, Jeremy Hunt is in breach of The National Health Service Act (S1) (1a). It states 'The Secretary of State must continue the promotion in England of a comprehensive health service designed to secure improvement in the physical and mental health of the people of England'. By cutting the budget of mental health trusts Jeremy Hunt is, potentially putting patients lives at risk; not promoting the NHS.

attributes.action: Change UK licensing laws to allow drug testing in nightclubs.
attributes.background: Despite current laws, 1 in 5 young adults used illicit drugs last year, of unknown purity and strength and have been attributed to the deaths of 50 people in 2014, a trend which is increasing. By allowing safe drug tests in venues, users will be aware of the composition and lives could be saved.
attributes.additional_details: Drug testing has been used in Europe and at UK festivals with Police and PHA support. There needs to be a debate on how this can be implemented across the night time industry so that it's customers can be as informed as they are with alcohol choices. The tragedy of these deaths is conversely having an impact on that economy. There were a further 14000 hospital admissions which is additional burden on the NHS. Statistics: http://digital.nhs.uk/catalogue/PUB21159/drug-misu-eng-2016-rep.pdf

attributes.action: Ban fireworks outside of events on specific days across the UK.
attributes.background:
In the weeks around Bonfire Night, fireworks are constantly being let off causing nothing but worry for pet owners. 

The noise and vibrations from fireworks can cause severe distress in both wild and domestic animals, meaning that owners have to take steps to alleviate their distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Bonfire 'Night' is often spread over a fortnight. This means that owners can find it difficult to plan for their animals. Fireworks have caused distress to all kinds of animals, not just cats and dogs. Smaller animals, such as rabbits, and farm animals, such as horses, can be affected too. 

This petition is calling for the government to specify days of the year on which the use of fireworks is legal, e.g. 5th November, 31st December, Diwali, and to ban their use outside of these dates.

attributes.action: Form a Home or National Defence Force of HM Forces Veterans.
attributes.background: There are thousands of able and willing HM Forces Veterans who would step forward if required to form a Home or National Defence Force to assist in Border Protection or assistance to Police and regular Forces in times of emergency, or civil unrest.
attributes.additional_details: These Veterans are a valuable asset to this Nation, well trained, experienced and able to fulfill tasks and roles during times of emergency or civil unrest.

attributes.action: Urgently ban the use of preventative antibiotics in animal agriculture.
attributes.background: Antibiotics used in agriculture are a serious the threat to human health. Overuse is driving up levels of antibiotic resistance, leading to new superbugs. There must be a total ban on "preventative antibiotic use" where animals are given the drugs to prevent infection or speed up their growth.
attributes.additional_details:
This ban should also cover imported meat where antibiotics have been used. In many countries throughout the world animals use more antibiotics than humans. 

The use of antibiotics in farming represents a critical threat to public health. If antibiotics stop working, which is a distinct possibility, the outcome could be apocalyptic for humanity. We would go back to the days where a small cut or infection could be fatal.

No new antibiotics have been discovered since 1987.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS wasting more time in the courts: Commission PrEP immediately.
attributes.background: PrEP stands for Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis. It's a course of HIV drugs for HIV negative people to take before sex to reduce their risk of contracting HIV. Research demonstrates that PrEP is as effective as condoms in preventing HIV transmission.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2016 NHS England stated that they were 'not responsible for commissioning PrEP’. Following a legal challenge from the National AIDS Trust, which the NHS wasted time and money appealing, the Court of Appeal has ruled that the NHS has the legal power to fund PrEP. 

The NHS’s decision has already been delayed for over 6 months, so we urgently call on Jeremy Hunt to make PrEP available on the NHS. 

Every day the NHS delays its decision, 17 more people will be diagnosed with HIV.

attributes.action: After The EU, Let The Public Decide Where £350 Million A Week Should Be Spent .
attributes.background:
After the EU Referendum held on June 23rd 2016, the public made a democratic decision not to spend £350 million a week on the EU. 

As the public made the democratic decision not to spend it on the EU, the public should now democratically decide what £350 million per week should then be spent on.
attributes.additional_details:
As Agriculture received the largest amount back from the money spent on EU membership, the government must pledge that the higher percentage of the money saved from not being in the EU will be spent on agriculture. 

Every 4 years the public should then have a democratic say on where the remaining percentage should be spent, through official voting on a ballot, with boxes asking if the money should be spent; either: completely on the NHS, on public services, or education. This must be honoured.

attributes.action: Debate the two letters from Professor A.C. Grayling and Phillip Kolvin QC.
attributes.background: I want action because I believe the arguments in these two letters are irrefutable.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.nchlondon.ac.uk/2016/07/01/professor-c-graylings-letter-650-mps-urging-parliament-not-support-motion-trigger-article-50-lisbon-treaty-1-july-2016/

attributes.action: Stop private companies offering NHS services from using the NHS logo.
attributes.background:
Private companies such as Serco, Circle, Virgin and others deliver NHS services using the NHS name and logo.

The public does not want the NHS privatised and most people have no idea that they are being treated by the private sector.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS logo is a tried and trusted brand. If private companies give poor care while operating under the NHS brand, the NHS is likely to get the blame

It is important that users of healthcare services know who is providing the care they are getting.

attributes.action: State Pension Payable Immediately On Completion Of 40 Years N.I. Contributions
attributes.background: Recent State Pension changes means many people will contribute around 50 years N.I contributions before they will receive a State Pension, despite the Government themselves saying 35 years is the amount of contributions needed to create it in the first place.     Pay the pension at 40 years maximum.
attributes.additional_details: If your employer say they will pay you £10 per hour for a fifty hour week, then you only receive £350, you'd feel a little more than a little miffed - but that's exactly the "deal" we are being sold by the Government with increased retirement ages.     By their own admission, you need to pay N.I. contributions for 35 years to get a full State Pension.     So why are we expected to work longer?     Any individual completing 40 years contributions should have their pension payable from that point.

attributes.action: The UK must ban the foreign financing of all new MOSQUES
attributes.background: As we go forward in the Uk,it has become apparent that the Uk like other European countries has a problem with the financing of mosques.We call on the government to ban all foreign finance from building or the planning of any new mosques

attributes.action: Class mysogynistic verbal harassment or physical approach as a hate crime in UK
attributes.background: Whether they are sexual or racial slurs, all verbal harassment and physical approaches are hate motivated. They are done to intimidate and cause upset/distress to the victim. Sexual harassment is still too often regarded as trivial and there is no current law that protects the public against it.
attributes.additional_details: Nottinghamshire police have started to record these instances of mysogynistic abuse as hate crimes, and this should be implimented nationwide. Whilst walking I was verbally harassed by a group of men in a car last night; the exact same thing happened to a friend. In this last week I have been yelled sexual comments at in the street by a man, and objectifyed so much on a busy train that I had to change carriage. Everyone has the right to live without being the target of sexual inappropriateness.

attributes.action: Child maintenance payments to be worked out from NET pay not GROSS pay.
attributes.background: Child maintenance should be work out for the paying parent from there NET pay NOT from there GROSS pay as the working parent does not even see nor take home in the bank the GROSS pay so they are getting penalized twice from the tax man and Child maintenance
attributes.additional_details:
Example: - Parent on £36,000 per year GROSS pay. 
Actual take home pay £24,000 per year NET pay. 
Child maintenance work out your weekly pay from £36,000 this would be £692.00 per week in pay. When actually your weekly take home pay is £461.00 
Action needs to be taken so that child maintenance is worked out from your NET pay not your GROSS pay as parents just cannot afford to live taking money from parents that do not even see this in the bank accounts. 

Please sign and make this happen for the paying parent. Everyone should pay for there child but it has to be fair.

attributes.action: Not just blindly leave the EU but instead establish a Royal Commission
attributes.background: The referendum was enacted so that a simple majority would be sufficient to establish a decision. For deciding the future of a union refined over 43 years, this would not make sense unless the result was advisory. Since the majority was 52% over 48%, the result should not be followed blindly.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition, there is evidence to suggest that many people used their vote not for its intended purpose but to register a protest with the government.

Also, in law the referendum result is not legally binding upon the government; it is merely advisory.

As such, the result should not be followed blindly, with no intervening steps between the result and the government acting to leave the EU.

The Government should establish a Royal Commission, or other suitable body, to investigate.

attributes.action: Class babies that have passed from 12 weeks on as stillbirth not miscarriage!
attributes.background: My daughter passed at 16 weeks gestation and i delivered her naturally at 20 weeks. She was perfect in everyway. Toes fingers everything all perfectly formed. She just wasnt alive. Shes down 'officially' as a miscarriage and i think the law on this needs changed!!
attributes.additional_details: Unfortunately a lot of babies who have passed before 24 weeks and are 'categorized' as a miscarriage. This itself is a miscarriage of justice. Our children were here, we held them, we talked to them. They may have been born sleeping but they were still born!!

attributes.action: To appoint an independent judicial body to review the EU referendum campaign
attributes.background: There have been considerable concerns regarding the statements that were made during the EU referendum campaign & then their subsequent retraction. Our aim is to investigate & hopefully to establish why such things happened during the course of the campaign & to learn the lessons for the future.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose that the House of Commons appoints an independent judicial committee, comprised of senior Commonwealth judges, to review claimed deceptions in the campaigns leading up to the poll of 23 June 2016 on the UK’s membership of the European Union.

Given the advisory nature of the referendum, this would enable a review of the alleged deceptions and their impact on voters, with the findings reported to Parliament- the ultimate arbiter on when article 50 should be implemented.

attributes.action: Extend the Animal Welfare Act 2006 to include crustaceans
attributes.background:
Crustaceans are not covered by existing animal welfare legislation. 
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 states that its protection can be extended to other types of animals if it can be proven that they are capable of experiencing pain.
Scientific evidence proves that crustaceans do feel pain.
attributes.additional_details:
There is much scientific evidence to suggest that crustaceans feel pain.
As crustaceans are not in the animal welfare act, they can be killed in any way. This usually involves boiling them or hacking them to pieces whilst they are still alive. 
Animal welfare organisations are calling for greater protection for these animals, based on sound scientific evidence and the provision in the Act.
Reference: RSPCA, Animal Aid and Shellfish network

attributes.action: Make it an offence for cyclists not to use a cycle lane where one is  provided.
attributes.background: Make it an offence for cyclists not to use a cycle lane where one is  provided and therefore they should not use roadways or footpaths adjacent.

attributes.action: Remove international students numbers from the Immigration statistics
attributes.background: Britain is acquiring a poor reputation as a study destination for foreign students which will be exacerbated by Brexit. We need to stabilise this important contributor to universities finances and the wider economy, and immediately address fears about Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013-14 there were almost 67,500 international students attending London universities – making up 18% of the total student population in the capital, and 22% of the 310,000 international students across the UK. They contribute £1.32bn in fees; £1.36bn in subsistence spending, and £121m from their friends and families who visit them in the UK.

attributes.action: Allow European residents living in UK to vote if there's another EU referendum
attributes.background: I am a Spanish resident living in London since 2000, working in the NHS and paying my taxes in this country. I believe is very unfair that the EU citizens did not have the opportunity to vote if we want to be out or in from the EU. My request is to give us a voice as we are tax payers supporting UK

attributes.action: Regulate all Online Animal Rescue Groups
attributes.background: After a bad experience with an online animal rescue group, who illegally re-homed my cat, I learned of others who had difficulties with them. Animal suffering was also suggested. Anyone can set up an online rescue group; there are no premises; they need no licence; the RSPCA  find it hard to inspect
attributes.additional_details:
Animal Welfare legislation is out  of date:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/animal-welfare-legislation-protecting-pets 
There is no legislation or governing body to check online rescue groups.
People need no prior animal rescue knowledge or experience to start a group. 
Immediately a group is set up they can ask for donations regardless of whether they are a registered charity or not. The groups are not accountable to anyone and nor are their financial records.
Many start off with good intent but cannot cope when they are inundated with animals and have a lack of funding.

attributes.action: Make chronic stomach/bowel conditions eligible for a disabled person's railcard
attributes.background: Many people who suffer from chronic stomach/bowel illnesses such as inflammatory bowel disease and irritable bowel syndrome will opt to use trains for long distance journeys, due to their accessible toilets, on demand. Due to the need for accessible toilets, we ask that sufferers receive a discount.
attributes.additional_details: Toilets are a major necessity for people who suffer from stomach/bowel conditions as they can be urgently needed at any time during a journey. This can prevent people from driving long journeys as service stations can often be few and far between. We ask that the government add chronic stomach/bowel illnesses to the list of conditions eligible for a disabled persons railcard. In some cases, people will choose a train journey instead of long car journeys to avoid embarrassment, anxiety and pain.
